## A Racing Glacier, Jakobshavn, Greenland

Greenland loses more ice through the Jakobshavn Glacier than from anywhere else on this huge ice sheet. Jakobshavn – one of the fastest moving glaciers in the world – travels up to 40 metres per day. Satellites show that recently it has been flowing more slowly and getting thicker, although it is still losing more ice than it gains. Observations from space are key to monitoring dynamic features such as this. 

Credits: ESA CCI; Polar Geospatial Center; contains modified Copernicus Sentinel data (2019), processed by ESA.
